title: Improve portfolio copywriting quality and consistency

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Current State

Copywriting quality is inconsistent across portfolio projects. Some projects (e.g., Couple-ish) have compelling, specific, results-driven copy, while others (e.g., 3M VHB Tapes, Binmetrics) have placeholder or generic text.

## Assessment Score: 6.5/10

### Strengths

- Strong project diversity showcased
- Compelling subtitles across most projects
- Couple-ish project demonstrates excellent writing (specific, story-driven, includes metrics)
- About section is concise and professional

### Weaknesses

- Inconsistent depth (some projects nearly empty)
- Generic process descriptions following templates
- Passive voice overuse
- Vague outcomes without metrics
- Buzzword overload without substance
- Inconsistent voice ("we" vs "I")

## Goals

- Achieve consistent 8.5/10 quality across all projects
- Add measurable outcomes and client impact
- Replace generic templates with specific insights
- Establish consistent voice and tone
- Fill content gaps in incomplete projects

## Priority Projects

1. 3M VHB Tapes (placeholder content)
2. Binmetrics (insufficient detail)
3. Branton (too wordy, needs tightening)
4. Super Burgers (generic process)
5. Merchant Ale House (lacks outcomes)
6. Additional projects needing polish

Huly Issue: PSITE-1

title: Develop blog content strategy and publish regular posts

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Current State

Blog is fully functional with Ghost CMS integration but severely underutilized:

- Only 1 published post: "Letta MCP Server: A Robust Middleware for AI Agent Management" (March 6, 2025)
- Clean, professional UI with good UX
- SEO-ready with meta tags and structured data
- Responsive card layout

## Problem

The blog is a valuable asset for:

- Demonstrating expertise and thought leadership
- Improving SEO and organic traffic
- Showcasing process and insights
- Building personal brand
- Engaging potential clients/employers

Currently, it's not serving any of these purposes due to lack of content.

## Goals

1. Establish consistent publishing schedule
2. Create 10-12 quality blog posts over next 3-6 months
3. Cover diverse topics that showcase expertise
4. Drive traffic and engagement
5. Support portfolio projects with deeper insights

## Content Pillars (Suggested)

### 1. Design Process & Insights

- Case study deep-dives (expand on portfolio projects)
- Design thinking and methodology
- Tools and workflows
- Before/after transformations

### 2. Technical Projects & Development

- 3D modeling and animation techniques
- Web development approaches
- AI and creative technology
- Tool comparisons and reviews

### 3. Creative Industry Insights

- Trends in design and technology
- Client collaboration best practices
- Freelance/agency experiences
- Industry commentary

### 4. Tutorials & How-Tos

- Specific techniques (Cinema 4D, Houdini, etc.)
- Workflow optimizations
- Problem-solving approaches
- Tool tips and tricks

## Initial Post Ideas

 1. "Behind the Scenes: Creating the Couple-ish Visual Identity" (expand on successful project)
 2. "From Concept to Render: My 3D Workflow for Product Visualization" (3M VHB case study)
 3. "Designing for Impact: Lessons from Voices Unheard AI Art Project"
 4. "Building a Modern Portfolio with React and Payload CMS" (technical)
 5. "The Evolution of Brand Identity: Garden City Essentials 5-Year Rebrand"
 6. "Procedural Design with Houdini: Creating Industrial Brand Treatments"
 7. "Why Every Designer Should Learn Basic Web Development"
 8. "Balancing Client Vision with Design Expertise: Real Stories"
 9. "My Essential Design and Development Toolkit in 2025"
10. "The Future of AI in Creative Work: Reflections and Experiments"

## Success Metrics

- Publish 1-2 posts per month consistently
- Average 500-1000 words per post
- Include relevant images/videos from projects
- Optimize for SEO (keywords, meta descriptions)
- Share on social media and professional networks
- Track analytics (views, engagement, referral traffic)

## Technical Enhancements (Optional)

- Add pagination for blog listing
- Implement related posts section
- Add social sharing buttons
- Consider newsletter signup integration
- Add comments (Disqus, Ghost comments, etc.)

## Timeline

- Month 1: Write and publish 2 posts
- Month 2: Write and publish 2 posts
- Month 3: Write and publish 1-2 posts
- Ongoing: 1 post per month minimum

## Projects Needing Polish

## Common Issues

- All follow same "discovery phase → iterations → final result" template
- Generic process descriptions
- Missing specific outcomes
- Passive voice overuse

## Requirements

For each project:

- Replace template language with unique insights
- Add specific design challenges and solutions
- Include measurable outcomes or client feedback
- Reduce buzzwords ("sophisticated," "innovative," etc.)

- Target: 300-400 words per project

Huly Issue: PSITE-21

title: Establish consistent voice and tone guidelines

comments.author: node
comments.text:
## Current Issue

Inconsistent use of "I" vs "we" across projects:

- Some projects use "we" (Super Burgers, Merchant Ale House)
- Some use "I" (Branton, Couple-ish)
- Unclear when collaboration vs solo work

## Requirements

- Decide on primary voice for personal portfolio
- Recommended: Use "I" for solo work, clarify team roles when collaborative
- Document voice/tone guidelines for future content
- Update existing projects for consistency

## Guidelines to Establish

- First person (I) vs collective (we) usage
- Active vs passive voice preference
- Tone: professional but personal vs formal
- Technical detail level
- Outcome presentation format

## Deliverable

- Brief style guide (1 page)
- Apply consistently across all projects
